result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases called at 9:11 AM: 21CF349, 22CF448.
Defendant Brian L Crogg in court and in custody without counsel.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant indicates that he would like to proceed without counsel. Court has colloquy with the Defendant regarding his right to an attorney. 
Court finds the defendant is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel but does appoint stand by counsel to assist the Defendant with proceedings.
22CF448: Defendant filed Motion to modify bond to remove the condition:" Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle" to : "Not to drive without a valid driver's license." 
State objects unless the Defendant has a valid drivers license. Defendant indicates he does have a valid driver's license. 
State moves to amend condition to: "Not to drive without a valid driver's license". Court so orders.
21CF349 to ride along with the Preliminary Hearing in 22CF448 on 11/15/22 at 1:00 PM and then both cases back to Branch 5 for STC on 11/21/22 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:

(9:29 AM cases 21CF349, 22CF448 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian L Crogg appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail without counsel.
State notes the defendant has a Preliminary Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 1:30 pm for case 22CF448.
Defendant advises is planning to represent self on these matters. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant requests to appear in person for future court appearances.
Defendant waives right to an attorney and Court accepts waiver to an attorney.
Defendant enters Not Guilty plea to 21CF349 and court notes this was previously done.
State doesn't have an offer for a global resolution at this time. State is to make an offer which includes both cases.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 14, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Status Conference in 21CF349 and Hearing in 22CF448 scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 9:15 pm in person.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:30 AM Cases called: 21CF349 & 22CF448. Defendant Brian L Crogg appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Brian L Crogg. Attorney Trenton Pilton in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to appear in person for today's hearing. 
Victim/Witness statute is complied with. 
Defendant is requesting a new attorney. Court grants Defendant's request for a new attorney. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to represent himself of retain private counsel. Defendant state's he makes too much to qualify for Public Defender. 
STC: 08/18/22 at 9:30am

(9:21 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian L Crogg does not appear in court or via Zoom. 
State requests to quash the warrant as the State was informed the defendant is on a commitment.
State requests the Court find good cause to extend the time for the preliminary hearing.
Court orders the warrant is quashed and finds good cause to extend time for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
